sense.def: work on, be engaged in, cultivate (literary pursuits, gardening etc); have as one's main concern
be worked on, be worked towards, be worked with
work on things; be engaged in things
為此詩者 "he who has written/composed this song": produce in writing> write; work on writing; compose
compose N which follows as S
use N2 as N1; treat2 as N1
CAUSE TO HAPPEN> produce; lead to
consider the contextually determinate object N1 as an N2, think of N1 as an N2
have thoughts about, be concerned with
if ZGC: 秦為知之，必不救也。

entry.def: The standard copula in Warring States Chinese is wéi 為, which tends to have human subjects and is by no means as common in Chinese as the copula is in Western languages.

sense.def: 為戮"get executed": have oneself VERBed
斯為美"this is the (most) admirable":be definable as, count as (particularly/distinctly/most) V-ing
be the most V; count as (the most) V 最為大
為...(為)... is it V1 or V2 (marker of alternative/disjunctive questions) (see also 為當, 為复, and 為是 in this function)
be identical with npro, be identifiable as npro
being an N to V; as an N to V
be N2 in relation to N1; cf. Russian я буду ЕМУ женой
for a contextually deteminate person or cause; for you; for us; for me
be for V-ing; serve for V-ing; have V-ing as a purpose
in order to V1 to go ahead and V2
acting for > in the interest of something; on someone's behalf; in someone's favour; for the sake of
for the sake of (oneself) 自為
do something contextually determinate for (one's own) sake 為己
work for; be on the side of; work for the benefit of; work towards; aim for; act in the spirit of 為公甚
work for (oneself), work in (one's own) interest
working for the occasion of S1, S2
for sake of N perform the action V
consider the contextually determinate subject N to V
consider that the contextually determinate N is V-ing 以為
以汝為死"thought you were dead", 以N為V: regard N as V-ing; believe that N V-s
be deemed to be N; be considered as N> come to be considered as, come to count as; count as N
take it to be the case that S, consider that S; recognise that S
consider N2 to be N1; consider N2 to represent N1
猶之為平"still consider it to be plain/level": consider npro to V
get to be deemed an N, get to be considered to be an N
繩之為度"the basic nature of the ink line as a measure" the nature as an N1 of N2

entry.def: Wéi 為, yǒu 有, yòng 用, lín 臨, lì 蒞, lǐ 理 are polite ways of referring to the government by a legitimate ruler.

sense.def: govern [a polity], run a government, run official affairs
govern; run the government of (a state)
plant so as to cultivate (rice etc)
was about to, was going to

entry.def: Wéi 為 and yú 於 are structural particles which abstractly indicate that certain verbs in their environment are passive.

sense.def: 為人戮"be killed by others"，為天下笑"become the laughing stock of the world, be the laughing stock of the world": marker of passive
為笑"be laughed at (by others)": be Vt-ed by the contextually determinate N

entry.def: Wéi 為 sometimes introduces a reason for something that is then introduced by gù 故"therefore" or by yīn 因 "therefore".

sense.def: because of, on account of V-ing
because of N; on N's behalf
be because of N, do because of N
be in favour of a contextually determinate person
work for; be in favour of
change (oneself) deliberately into being V. make (oneself) V
become N1 as result of the process VtoN2

entry.def: Wéi 為 (ant. wú wéi 無為 "not engage in purposeful and result-orientated self-assertive action") focusses not on the act itself but primarily on the results achieved or aimed for. [OCCASIONAL], [PURPOSEFUL]

sense.def: action; actual behaviour, concrete actions; kind of behaviour
engage in assertive action, "try something funny"; be deliberate in action
be being (為恭 "you are being polite")
act as; fulfill the function of (occasionally also: pretend to be), impersonate,
to be done, be carried out 難為 "hard to do"
undertake to practice; do deliberately (something right or something wrong); act out deliberately (a virtue); set out deliberately to practise
act on, fiddle with, (interfere with through artificial deliberate action)
be prepared to do; come to do, get to commit (mistakes etc)

entry.def: The most common word for producing something is wéi 為.

sense.def: try to produce something (N2) for someone (N1)
make/produce/reproduce (physically), construct, build (a platform, a house)
have produced for one (ear-rings to give to the ruler)
constitute, produce something by transforming something to it
produce (a theory, a thesis, a text)
produce N1 using N2; make N1 of N2
produce (or create) an N for Npro, make an N for Npro
be cured 不可為 "nothing can be done about it"

entry.def: The standard general word for becoming is wéi 為.

sense.def: to become (something or somebody N1) (for somebody else N2) 為之氓
subject situation: lead to (a new event or situation)
get done, achieve; be good for

entry.def: Refers always verbally to something belonging formally to an owner.

The most general word is probably wéi 為 and this is sometimes used to refer to the act of cultural invention or creation, and the connotation may be positive or negative. The word focusses on the act of making something as such rather than the product as such.

sense.def: PRODUCE> to invent, to create for the first time; create anew; create out of nothing
how? (i.e. in no way); for what? to what purpose? (with or without additional 何）

entry.def: Wéi 為 "make into" is a neutral informal term which does not primarily refer to the formal investment or any transferring of the insignia of office. [GENERAL], [INFORMAL]

sense.def: CAUSE TO BECOME> appoint as (a successor etc); make into (one's ruler/tutor etc)
appoint someone contextually determinate N1 as (something N2)
count as especially V; be regarded as typically V
bring it about that S (cf HYDCD sub verbo no. 29: 使，致使)
read wèi: provide N2 for N1
